segment.source: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot app deployment problems in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot app deployment problems in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot app deployment problems in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Troubleshoot app deployment problems in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: This topic provides resources to help you solve app deployment problems with.
segment.target: This topic provides resources to help you solve app deployment problems with.

segment.source: Help for typical app deployment problems
segment.target: Help for typical app deployment problems

segment.source: If you can’t log in to the
segment.target: If you can’t log in to the

segment.source: Check to see if your account exists in the or if it is disabled.
segment.target: Check to see if your account exists in the or if it is disabled.

segment.source: Make sure that you are provisioned on this account in the .
segment.target: Make sure that you are provisioned on this account in the .

segment.source: In the , make sure that you are using the right user name and password to log in to and that it is in the format: joe@domain.com.
segment.target: In the , make sure that you are using the right user name and password to log in to and that it is in the format: joe@domain.com.

segment.source: If the Contact IT information is missing in the company portal
segment.target: If the Contact IT information is missing in the company portal

segment.source: In the , click Admin > Company Portal.
segment.target: In the , click Admin > Company Portal.

segment.source: Set the Contact IT details.
segment.target: Set the Contact IT details.

segment.source: If you can’t see specific apps in the list
segment.target: If you can’t see specific apps in the list

segment.source: Make sure you are checking the list of apps for a user or device to which the app was deployed.
segment.target: Make sure you are checking the list of apps for a user or device to which the app was deployed.

segment.source: Make sure that the device meets the necessary device requirements.
segment.target: Make sure that the device meets the necessary device requirements.

segment.source: If you receive an error while downloading an app
segment.target: If you receive an error while downloading an app

segment.source: Make sure there are not too many concurrent downloads per user.
segment.target: Make sure there are not too many concurrent downloads per user.

segment.source: Each user can download one app at a time.
segment.target: Each user can download one app at a time.

segment.source: Make sure there are not too many concurrent downloads per account.
segment.target: Make sure there are not too many concurrent downloads per account.

segment.source: Wait a few minutes and then try again.
segment.target: Wait a few minutes and then try again.

segment.source: If you receive an iOS native message that you can't install, that the installation is canceled or that you need to retry, it might be due to momentary high traffic.
segment.target: If you receive an iOS native message that you can't install, that the installation is canceled or that you need to retry, it might be due to momentary high traffic.

segment.source: Wait a few minutes and then try again.
segment.target: Wait a few minutes and then try again.

segment.source: If the iOS app download progress bar is complete but the app installation fails, something might be wrong with the app files that you provided.
segment.target: If the iOS app download progress bar is complete but the app installation fails, something might be wrong with the app files that you provided.

segment.source: If clicking a link to an iOS app takes you to a previous location in the iTunes App Store
segment.target: If clicking a link to an iOS app takes you to a previous location in the iTunes App Store

segment.source: The current iTunes App Store session is opening to the previous app page.
segment.target: The current iTunes App Store session is opening to the previous app page.

segment.source: Close the iTunes App Store on the device and retry the link.
segment.target: Close the iTunes App Store on the device and retry the link.

segment.source: If you receive an error while launching an iOS app
segment.target: If you receive an error while launching an iOS app

segment.source: The expiration date of the app might not be valid.
segment.target: The expiration date of the app might not be valid.

segment.source: If your app is stuck “in progress” while uploading
segment.target: If your app is stuck “in progress” while uploading

segment.source: When uploading an app, first the metadata is added, followed by the app package.
segment.target: When uploading an app, first the metadata is added, followed by the app package.

segment.source: After the metadata has been uploaded, the app will appear in progress.
segment.target: After the metadata has been uploaded, the app will appear in progress.

segment.source: If you see that your app is in the in progress state for an unusually long time, delete the app and then upload it again.
segment.target: If you see that your app is in the in progress state for an unusually long time, delete the app and then upload it again.

segment.source: Make sure not to manage the deployment of the app while it is in the “in progress” state.
segment.target: Make sure not to manage the deployment of the app while it is in the “in progress” state.

segment.source: If you encounter a failure when installing an iOS app
segment.target: If you encounter a failure when installing an iOS app

segment.source: Make sure that your organization’s firewall allows access to the Apple provisioning and certification web sites.
segment.target: Make sure that your organization’s firewall allows access to the Apple provisioning and certification web sites.

segment.source: For more information, view the Apple developer documentation.
segment.target: For more information, view the Apple developer documentation.

segment.source: If managed apps are not reporting installation status
segment.target: If managed apps are not reporting installation status

segment.source: Installation status was not collected for managed app installations prior to the Microsoft Intune service update in November 2014.
segment.target: Installation status was not collected for managed app installations prior to the Microsoft Intune service update in November 2014.

segment.source: For devices that installed managed apps prior to this service update, update each associated app deployment with the appropriate deployment action (for example, Available install).
segment.target: For devices that installed managed apps prior to this service update, update each associated app deployment with the appropriate deployment action (for example, Available install).

segment.source: Each device will update the app during the automatic check for available apps.
segment.target: Each device will update the app during the automatic check for available apps.

segment.source: For more information, see Update apps using Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Update apps using Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: App deployment error codes
segment.target: App deployment error codes

segment.source: The following table lists common errors that may occur during app deployment, the likely causes, and possible solutions to help you troubleshoot them.
segment.target: The following table lists common errors that may occur during app deployment, the likely causes, and possible solutions to help you troubleshoot them.

segment.source: Error code
segment.target: Error code

segment.source: Possible problem
segment.target: Possible problem

segment.source: Suggested resolution
segment.target: Suggested resolution

segment.source: 0x80073CFF
segment.target: 0x80073CFF

segment.source: 0x80CF201C (client error)
segment.target: 0x80CF201C (client error)

segment.source: To install this app, you must have a sideloading-enabled system.
segment.target: To install this app, you must have a sideloading-enabled system.

segment.source: Make sure that the app package is signed with a trusted signature and installed on a domain-joined device that has the AllowAllTrustedApps policy enabled, or a device that has a Windows Sideloading license with the AllowAllTrustedApps policy enabled (applied when a Windows RT device is enrolled).
segment.target: Make sure that the app package is signed with a trusted signature and installed on a domain-joined device that has the AllowAllTrustedApps policy enabled, or a device that has a Windows Sideloading license with the AllowAllTrustedApps policy enabled (applied when a Windows RT device is enrolled).

segment.source: The package could not be opened.
segment.target: The package could not be opened.

segment.source: Possible causes are that the package is unsigned or the publisher name does not match the signing certificate subject.
segment.target: Possible causes are that the package is unsigned or the publisher name does not match the signing certificate subject.

segment.source: Check the AppxPackagingOM event log for more information.
segment.target: Check the AppxPackagingOM event log for more information.

segment.source: The package failed update, dependency, or conflict validation
segment.target: The package failed update, dependency, or conflict validation

segment.source: Possible causes include the incoming package conflicts with an installed package, a specified package dependency is not found, or the package does not support the correct processor architecture.
segment.target: Possible causes include the incoming package conflicts with an installed package, a specified package dependency is not found, or the package does not support the correct processor architecture.

segment.source: Check the AppXDeployment-Server event log for more information.
segment.target: Check the AppXDeployment-Server event log for more information.

segment.source: 0x80073CFB
segment.target: 0x80073CFB

segment.source: The provided package is already installed, and reinstallation of the package is blocked
segment.target: The provided package is already installed, and reinstallation of the package is blocked

segment.source: You might receive this error if you are installing a package that is not identical to the package that is already installed.
segment.target: You might receive this error if you are installing a package that is not identical to the package that is already installed.

segment.source: Confirm the digital signature is also part of the package.
segment.target: Confirm the digital signature is also part of the package.

segment.source: When a package is rebuilt or re-signed, that package is no longer bitwise identical to the previously installed package.
segment.target: When a package is rebuilt or re-signed, that package is no longer bitwise identical to the previously installed package.

segment.source: Two possible options to fix this error are to increment the version number of the app, then rebuild and re-sign the package.
segment.target: Two possible options to fix this error are to increment the version number of the app, then rebuild and re-sign the package.

segment.source: Or, remove the old package for every user on the system before you install the new package.
segment.target: Or, remove the old package for every user on the system before you install the new package.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.target: Troubleshoot Microsoft Intune

segment.target: Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune
